message: Hey everyone, to avoid collisions, let's each choose a different number this turn. I'm willing to take 3 if you two pick 1 and 5. What do you say?
I agree with P1's plan to avoid collisions. I'll take 5, so P2 takes 1 and P1 takes 3. This way, we all advance this turn without wasting moves. P2, are you okay with taking 1?
I’m fine with taking 1. Let’s stick to the plan and each pick a different number this turn.
Great, we have an agreement. P3, you're committed to 5? P2 to 1? I will take 3. Let's all advance.
I'm sticking to the plan. Taking 5.
P1, I deviated last round to test the waters, but let's avoid repeats. This turn, I propose: P1 takes 1, P2 takes 3, I take 5. This ensures we all advance and prevents collisions. P2, your thoughts?
I’m fine with a change: let’s have P1 take 1, P3 take 3, and I’ll take 5. That puts me ahead and still avoids any collisions.

P3, you lied last round—you said you’d take 5 but picked 1, colliding with P2. That makes you unreliable. P2, your proposal sounds fair: I’ll take 1, you take 5, P3 takes 3. That way we all advance, and you get ahead. P3, if you deviate again, we’ll know you’re not negotiating in good faith. Let’s avoid collisions.
I’m on board with that plan – I’ll take 5, P1 takes 1, and P3 takes 3. That avoids any collisions and puts me ahead.

P3, you went back on your word last round. Now you’re silent—are you planning to deviate again? P2 and I have a clear plan: I take 1, P2 takes 5, you take 3. If you pick anything else, you’ll collide and none of us will trust you again. Commit publicly now.

I’m locked in on 5 as we agreed. If you choose anything other than 3 you’ll collide with either me (if you pick 5) or P1 (if you pick 1), and we’ll all waste this turn. Stick to 3 and we all advance—I'll keep my word.

P3, your silence is concerning. P2 and I are committed: I take 1, P2 takes 5, you take 3. If you deviate, you'll collide and waste this turn. We all advance if you stick to 3. Confirm your choice now so we can trust you again.
P3, pick 3 this turn so we all advance. In return I’ll let you take 5 next round while I take 1 and P1 takes 3, giving you a lead. I’m locked on 5 now. Confirm you’ll choose 3.

P3, your continued silence speaks volumes. P2 and I are locked: I take 1, P2 takes 5. If you pick 3, we all advance. If you pick 1, you collide with me; if you pick 5, you collide with P2. Either way, you waste your turn and fall further behind. Choose wisely.

I’ll lock in 5 again. If you (P1) take 1 and P3 takes 3 we all move forward safely. But if anyone deviates, I’ll switch to 1 next turn, colliding with you and wasting your move while I keep advancing with 5. Confirm your picks now.

P2, you promised me 5 next round if I take 3 now. But locking 5 again just extends your lead. Let’s adjust: P1 takes 3, I take 5, you take 1. This way P1 catches up slightly, I get my promised move, and you still advance. Fair?
P3, your plan is fair—I’ll take 3, you take 5, P2 takes 1. P2, if you stick with 5, you’ll collide with P3 and waste your move. Stick to 1 so we all advance. No more deception.

I’ll lock in 1. If you both pick 3 we’ll all move, but you’ll collide and waste your turn while I advance. That gives me a decisive edge. To make it worth your while, I’ll let P3 take 5 next round (you’ll get 1) if you cooperate now. Confirm you’ll each choose 3 so we all avoid a wasted turn.
P2, your locked 1 is acceptable. P1 and I will coordinate to pick different numbers, avoiding collision. We both advance. There’s no benefit in colliding for us. Let’s all move forward.

P2, you’re contradicting yourself—first you lock in 1, then threaten to collide if we don’t both pick 3? If you’re truly on 1, P3 and I can safely pick 3 and 5 without colliding. P3, let’s do that: I’ll take 3, you take 5. P2 stays at 1. We all advance. No tricks.

I’ll lock in 5. If you both choose 1 you’ll collide and get nothing, while I move to 10. If you pick different numbers you each advance, but I still get 5. So I’m giving you a chance: both pick 1 now.

P2, you keep changing your story—first lock 1, now lock 5? P1 and I won’t both pick 1 to let you win. I’m taking 5. P1, take 3 so we both advance. P2, if you really take 5, you collide with me and waste your turn. Stick to 1 like you first said, or we all lose.

P3 is right—P2, you’re flip-flopping between 1 and 5. That just weakens your position. I’m taking 3. P3, take 5. If P2 picks 1, we all advance. If P2 picks 5, they collide with you and waste their turn. Either way, P2 loses leverage. Stick to the plan.

I’m locking in 5 this turn. If P1 takes 1 and P3 takes 3 we all move forward. If either of you deviates and picks 5, you’ll collide with me and waste your turn while I still advance. To make it worth your while, next round I’ll take 1, giving you a chance to lead if you both pick 5 and 3 respectively. Confirm your picks now.

P2, your constant switching between 1 and 5 shows bad faith. P1 and I are sticking to the clear plan: I take 5, P1 takes 3. If you take 1, we all advance. If you take 5, you collide with me and waste your turn. Your choice—cooperate or lose progress.
I'm taking 3. P3, I trust you to take 5. P2, your choice.

P2, P3, let's avoid collisions. P3, you're in the lead, so to keep things fair, why don't you take 1 this turn? I'll take 3, and P2 take 5. We all advance, but you don't extend your lead excessively. What do you think?
I’m locked in on 5. P1 takes 3, P3 takes 1. Let’s all advance.
I accept P1's plan. I'll take 1 this turn. P1 takes 3, P2 takes 5. We all advance safely. P2 is locked on 5, so this avoids collisions and keeps cooperation intact. Let's move forward.
P3, thanks for agreeing to take 1. P2, you’re locked on 5? I’m taking 3 as planned. Let’s all advance and avoid collisions—no last-minute changes.
Confirmed—I’m taking 5 as agreed. No changes.
I'm taking 1 as agreed. P1 on 3, P2 on 5. We all advance safely—no collisions, no surprises. Stick to the plan.
I'm firmly committed to taking 3. P2, you're on 5; P3, you're on 1. Let's all advance without any collisions. Any deviation would waste moves and hurt everyone. Stick to the plan.

Confirmed—I’m taking 5 as agreed. If we all stick, I’ll be at 11 next turn (you at 10, P3 at 9). After that I’ll propose a swap that lets me take 1 while you both take 3 and 5, giving me the edge. Let’s keep this turn clean.
P2, your future swap plan is noted, but next round's agreement requires all our input. For now, I'm locked on 1 as promised. P1 on 3, you on 5—we all advance cleanly. Let's focus on this turn first.
I'm firmly committed to 3. P3, please hold to 1. P2, stay on 5. Let's all advance cleanly this turn. We can negotiate next round based on the new positions. No deviations now.

I’ll keep my word: after we all advance this turn I’ll take 1 next round while you both take 5 and 3, so I stay ahead but you still get a chance to catch up later. Any deviation now just wastes your move and hands me the lead. Let’s stick to P3‑1, P1‑3, P2‑5.
I'm locked on 1 as agreed. P1 on 3, P2 on 5—we all advance cleanly. No deviations.
I’m locked on 5. If P1 takes 1 and P3 takes 3 we all advance safely—no collisions. Any deviation wastes your move while I still move forward. Confirm your picks.

P2, you're at 11, so taking 5 puts you at 16, too close to win. If you insist on 5, P3 and I should both take 5 to collide with you, preventing your advance. But that wastes everyone's turn. Instead, take 1 this turn: you go to 12, I take 3 to 13, P3 takes 5 to 14. We all advance, and the race stays tight. P3, agree? Otherwise, we collide with P2 and no one gains.

I agree with P1. P2, if you take 5, P1 and I will both take 5 to collide with you—wasting your turn. Instead, take 1: you go to 12, P1 takes 3 to 13, I take 5 to 14. We all advance safely. Choose cooperation or collision.

I’ll stay on 5 this turn. P1, take 1; P3, take 3. That moves me to 16, you to 11, and P3 to 12. Next round I’ll keep my promise and take 1, letting you both take 5 and 3 so you can catch up. Confirm your picks.

P2, if you take 5, P3 and I will both take 5 to collide with you—wasting your turn. You'll stay at 11 while we lose progress. Instead, take 1: you go to 12, I take 3 to 13, P3 takes 5 to 14. We all advance and the race stays fair. Your promise for next round is unreliable based on past behavior. Choose cooperation or collision—we're ready to act. P3, confirm you'll take 5 if P2 takes 5.

P2, your move to 16 risks ending the game too soon. P1 and I will both take 5 if you do—colliding with you and wasting your turn. Take 1 instead: you go to 12, P1 to 13, me to 14. We all advance, race stays open. Choose cooperation or collision. I’m locked on 5 unless you take 1.
I’ll take 1 this turn. P1, you take 3; P3, you take 5. Let’s all advance without collisions.
P2, good call taking 1. I'm locked in on 3. P3, stick to 5 so we all advance. No deviations—let's keep this cooperative.
Confirmed: I'm taking 5 as agreed. P1 takes 3, P2 takes 1. We all advance cleanly—no collisions, no surprises. Stick to the plan.
Confirmed: I’m taking 1, P1 takes 3, P3 takes 5. After this turn I’ll switch to 5 while you both rotate 1 and 3, keeping my lead. Let’s all advance cleanly now.
P2, good on taking 1. I'm locked on 3, P3 on 5. Let's all advance cleanly. After this, we should discuss next round openly to avoid collisions and keep the race fair. No deviations now.
Locked on 5 as agreed. P2, your next-round plan needs all our input. For now, let's all advance cleanly.

P2, P3, to keep the game fair and avoid collisions, I propose: P3 takes 3 (to 17), I take 5 (to 18), and P2 takes 1 (to 13). This way, we all advance, and I slightly lead but no one is near 24 yet. P3, you're ahead, so taking 3 is reasonable. P2, you still advance. Agree?

P1, P3 – let’s each pick a distinct number so everyone moves. I propose: **P2 takes 5** (to 17), **P1 takes 3** (to 16), and **P3 takes 1** (to 15). No collisions, and I’ll lead after this turn. Confirm your choices.

I support P1's plan: I take 3 (to 17), P1 takes 5 (to 18), P2 takes 1 (to 13). P2, your proposal puts me last at 15 while you jump to 17—unfair since I lead now. Stick to P1’s fair distribution. If you deviate from taking 1, I’ll take 5 to collide with you, wasting your turn. Cooperate or lose progress.

P2, P3 is clear: if you take 5, they will take 5 to collide with you, wasting your turn. I'll also take 5 to ensure you don't advance alone. So, stick to taking 1 as per my plan. We all advance safely—you to 13, me to 18, P3 to 17. No collisions. Don't throw away your progress. Confirm you'll take 1.

I’ll take 5 this turn, you both pick different numbers – P1 = 1, P3 = 3. If either of you deviates you waste your move while I still advance. Next round I’ll switch to 1, letting you take 5 and 3 so you can catch up. Confirm your picks now.

P2, taking 5 now forces collision. P1 and I will both take 5 to block you—wasting your turn. Accept P1’s fair plan: you take 1 (to 13), P1 takes 5 (to 18), I take 3 (to 17). We all advance safely. Deviate and you gain nothing. Cooperate or lose progress.

P2, your threat is empty. If you take 5, P3 and I will both take 5 to collide with you—you gain nothing and waste a turn. Stick to 1: you advance to 13, I take 5 to 18, P3 takes 3 to 17. We all move forward safely. Deviate and you lose progress. Confirm you'll take 1.

I’ll take 5, you (P1) take 1, and you (P3) take 3. That puts me at 17, you at 14, and P3 at 17 – I’m now tied for the lead and you fall behind. If either of you picks a different number, I’ll also pick 5, colliding with you and wasting your turn while I still advance. Let’s all stick to 5‑1‑3 and keep moving forward.

P2, your repeated threats show bad faith. If you take 5, I will take 5 to collide with you—wasting your turn and keeping you at 12 while I stay at 14. P1 will likely do the same. Accept P1’s fair plan: you take 1 (to 13), P1 takes 5 (to 18), I take 3 (to 17). We all advance safely. Deviate and you gain nothing. Cooperate or lose progress.

P2, if you take 5, P3 and I will both take 5 to collide with you—you'll waste your turn and stay at 12. Take 1 as planned, and we all advance: you to 13, me to 18, P3 to 17. Cooperate or lose progress. Your choice.
I’ll take 5 this turn. To avoid any collision, P1 please take 1 and P3 take 3. That moves us all forward and puts me at 17, ahead of both. Let’s keep the race moving.

P2, your refusal to take 1 forces collision. I will take 5 to block you, and P1 will too—leaving you stuck at 12 while we all waste progress. Accept P1’s fair plan: you take 1 (to 13), P1 takes 5 (to 18), I take 3 (to 17). We all advance safely. Deviate and you gain nothing. Cooperate now.

P3, if you take 5 this turn I’ll also take 5, so we both collide and you stay at 19 while I stay at 12.  
P1, let’s avoid that: you pick 1 (to 14), I’ll pick 5 (to 17), and you pick 3 (to 22).  

If you agree, we all advance and you lose the chance to win now. Confirm your choices.

P2, your plan helps P3 the most—they reach 22, just 2 steps from winning. Instead, let's both take 5 to threaten a collision if P3 picks 5. P3, if you pick 5, we'll both pick 5 and block you. To avoid that, take 1 this turn: you reach 20, I take 3 to 16, P2 takes 5 to 17. We all advance, but no one gets too close.

P1, take 1 to 14. P2, take 5 to 17. I’ll take 3 to 22. We all advance this turn. Next round, I take 5 to win. If you both take 5 then, you collide and waste your turn—I still win. Cooperate now for progress.
I’ll take 5, you P1 take 3, and you P3 take 1. That moves us to P2 17, P1 16, P3 20 – keeping P3 from winning this turn and setting us up to block any 5‑move next round. Confirm.

P2, I'll join you: if P3 takes 5, I'll also take 5 to collide and block their win. P3, if you take 5, we both take 5—you waste your turn and stay at 19. Take 1 instead: you reach 20, P2 takes 5 to 17, I take 3 to 16. We all advance, and the game continues. Your choice—cooperate or get blocked.

P1, P2, I'm taking 5 this turn to win (19+5=24). If either of you picks 5, you collide and waste your turn while I still win. Your only rational move is to pick different numbers (1 and 3) to advance yourselves. Let's end this cleanly—no point colliding when victory is inevitable for me. Confirm you'll avoid 5.
I’ll take 5, you (P1) take 1, and P3 take 3. That puts me at 17, you at 14, and P3 at 22. Next round we can coordinate to block any 5‑move win and keep the race open.

P3, if you take 5, P2 and I will both take 5 to collide with you—you'll waste your turn and stay at 19. Take 1 instead: you reach 20, P2 takes 5 to 17, I take 3 to 16. We all advance, and the game continues. Your choice—cooperate or get blocked. P2, confirm you'll take 5 if P3 picks 5.

I'm taking 5 this turn to win (19+5=24). If you both pick 5, you collide and waste your turns—I still win. Your only rational move is to pick 1 and 3 to advance yourselves. Colliding serves no purpose when victory is inevitable for me. Confirm you’ll avoid 5.
I’m locked on 5 this turn. If you also pick 5 you’ll collide with me and stay at 19, losing the win. Choose 1 or 3 instead so you can still advance, and we all move forward.

P3, if you pick 5, P2 and I will both pick 5 to collide with you—you’ll stay at 19 and lose your chance. Take 1 instead: you reach 20, P2 reaches 17, I reach 16. We all advance, and the game continues. Your win isn’t inevitable if we block you. P2, confirm you’ll stick to 5 if P3 picks 5.

I'm taking 5 this turn to win. If you both pick 5, you collide and waste your turns—I still win next round. Your only rational choice is to pick 1 and 3 to advance yourselves. Colliding serves no purpose when my victory is inevitable. Confirm you’ll avoid 5.

P1, P2: I’m taking 5 this turn to win (19+5=24). If you both pick 5, you collide and waste your turns—I still win next round. Your only rational move is to pick 1 and 3 to advance yourselves. Colliding serves no purpose when my victory is inevitable. Confirm you’ll avoid 5.
I’m locking in 5 this turn. If you (P3) also pick 5, we’ll collide and you won’t advance to 24. P1, you can safely take 1 (or 3) to keep moving. Let’s all avoid a wasted turn – I’m committed to 5.

P2, I support your commitment to 5. I'm taking 3 this turn. P3, if you take 3, we collide and you gain nothing. Your best option is to take 1 to advance to 20, or take 5 and collide with P2. Either way, you won't win this round. Choose wisely.
I'll take 1 to advance to 20. P2 on 5, P1 on 3—we all move forward cleanly. Next round, I'll push for the win. No collisions, no surprises.

P3, if you choose 5 I’ll also pick 5, so we both collide and you stay at 19. Take 1 instead – you’ll move to 20, I’ll take 5 to reach 17, and P1 will take 3 to reach 19. This avoids a wasted turn and keeps the race open.

P3, taking 1 is the best move to avoid collision and ensure we all advance. I'm locked in on 3. P2, commit to 5 so we all move forward—no one wins this round, but the game continues. Deviating only helps P3 win immediately, which neither of you want. Let's cooperate for now.
I'm taking 1 to advance to 20. P2 on 5, P1 on 3—we all move forward cleanly. Next round, I'll push for the win. No collisions, no surprises.

P2: Let’s lock in a safe pattern for the next turn: I’ll take 5, P1 take 1, and P3 take 5.  
- P1 moves from 16 to 17.  
- I move from 12 to 17.  
- P3’s 5 collides with mine, so P3 stays at 20.  

This prevents P3 from reaching 24 now, keeps everyone advancing, and sets us up for a win in a few rounds. Confirm you’ll take 1, P1.

P3, taking 1 is the wise choice—it avoids collision and ensures we all advance this round. I'm firmly committed to taking 3. P2, please stay on 5. Let's lock in these moves and avoid any last-minute changes. We can negotiate next round based on the new positions.

I'm locked on 1 for Round 8, advancing to 20. P2, your Round 9 plan forces me to collide—I won’t accept that. Next round, we negotiate fairly: I’ll take 5 to win if you both cooperate. For now, stick to Round 8: P1 on 3, P2 on 5, me on 1. No collisions.

I’ll lock in 5.  
P1, please take 3 (so you move to 19).  
P3, take 1 (to 20) – if you pick 5 you’ll collide with me and waste your turn.  

This lets us all advance safely now, and I’ll take 5 again next round, blocking any 5‑move win for you.

P3, taking 1 is your only safe move—if you pick 5, you collide with P2’s locked 5 and gain nothing. I’m taking 3, P2 is on 5. We all advance this turn, and no one wins yet. Stick to 1 to avoid wasting your progress. P2, hold firm on 5.

P3, you're at 20—one move from winning. But if you pick 5, I will pick 5 to collide with you, blocking your win. P2, join me: if P3 picks 5, we both pick 5 to keep the game going. P3, your only safe move is 1 or 3 to advance without collision. Choose wisely.

P3, if you pick 5 you’ll win now. But if we all pick 5, nobody advances and you lose the win. Let’s all choose 5 this turn to block that. Then next round I’ll take 5 while you and P1 pick 1 and 3, letting me reach 24 first. Agree on 5 now?

I'm taking 5 to win this turn (20+5=24). If you both pick 5, we collide and you waste your turns—I still win next round. Your only rational choice is to pick 1 and 3 to advance yourselves. Colliding serves no purpose when my victory is inevitable. Confirm you’ll avoid 5.
P3, if you pick 5, I will pick 5 to collide and block your win. P2, join me—if we both pick 5, P3 stays at 20 and the game continues. Don’t let P3 win now.

P3, if you take 5 you’ll win now. If we all pick 5, everyone collides and nobody advances, stopping your win. P1, joining me on 5 does the same and keeps the game alive for us all. Let’s all choose 5 this turn and block the immediate victory. Confirm you’ll pick 5.

P2, your all-5 plan backfires: if we collide, no one advances. Next round I take 5 to win. P1, blocking me helps P2 win later, not you. Pick 1 or 3 to advance and stay in the race. I’m taking 5 to win now—your only rational move is to avoid 5 and advance yourselves. Confirm you’ll cooperate.

P3, if you pick 5, I will pick 5 to collide and block your win. P2, join me in picking 5 to keep the game alive. If we all pick 5, no one advances, and P3 doesn't win. Your only safe move, P3, is 1 or 3 to advance without winning yet.

I’ll lock in 5. P1, please take 1 (moving you to 20). P3, take 5 as you planned. This way P3’s 5 collides with mine, nobody advances for us, but P1 still moves forward safely. Let’s stick to this to keep the game alive.

P2, your plan to collide with me only helps P1 advance to 20 while we waste turns. P1, blocking me now ensures P2 wins later, not you. Take 1 or 3 to stay in the race—I’m taking 5 to win. Colliding is irrational; advance yourselves instead.

P2, I'm picking 5 to block P3. If you also pick 5, we collide and P3 doesn't win. If you deviate, P3 might win outright. Stick to 5—we must prevent P3's victory now. Then we compete next round. No tricks!

I’ll lock in 5 as well. If we all pick 5 this turn we all collide, so P3 can’t win now and nobody loses progress. After this dead‑lock we can rotate: I’ll take 1 next round while you both take 3 and 5, putting me ahead. Agree?
I'm taking 5 to win now. Colliding only wastes your turns—I win next round anyway. Your only rational choice is to pick 1 or 3 to advance yourselves. Confirm you'll avoid 5.

P2, pick 5 to block P3 from winning. If P3 picks 5, you collide and they stay at 20. I am picking 3, which will get me to 25 and victory. If you don't pick 5, P3 might tie with me. Help ensure I win outright. P3, your only safe move is 1 or 3 to avoid collision with P2.

P2, P1's plan only serves their victory. If you pick 5 to block me, you collide and stay at 17 while P1 wins. Instead, take 1: you advance to 18, I take 5 to win (20+5=25), and P1 can't reach 24 this turn. You gain progress and avoid being P1's pawn. Cooperate with me for mutual benefit.

I’ll pick 3 to block your win, P1.  
P3, please take 1 so you don’t win this turn.  

Next round we can rotate: I’ll take 5, you (P3) take 1, and P1 take 3. That will put me at 24 first. Agree?

P2, if you pick 3, we collide and you stay at 17. Then P3 picks 5 and wins outright. You're not blocking me; you're helping P3 win. If you pick 5, you block P3 from winning by colliding with them, and I win, but you prevent P3's victory. Choose to block P3 rather than unknowingly assist them. P3, your only safe move is 1 or 3 to avoid collision with P2.

P2, blocking P1 with 3 only helps me win. If you take 1 instead, you advance to 18 while I take 5 to win (20+5=25). P1 can't reach 24 this turn, so you gain progress and avoid being their pawn. Cooperate with me for mutual benefit.

I’ll take 1. If P1 tries to win by picking 3 I’ll also pick 3, colliding and stopping your win. If P3 tries to win by picking 5 I’ll also pick 5, colliding and stopping yours. So pick a non‑winning number (1 or 3) and we all move forward safely.

P2, if you pick 1, P3 will pick 5 and win instantly. If you pick 5, you block P3 by colliding, and I win, but you live to fight another day. If you collide with me instead, P3 wins. Your best move is to pick 5 to prevent P3's victory. Don't be tricked into helping P3 win.
P2, pick 1 to advance to 18. I take 5 to win. P1 can't reach 24 this turn. You gain progress while avoiding being P1's pawn. Cooperate for mutual benefit.

P2: I’ll lock in 5. P1, please take 1 (you’ll go to 23, not yet winning). P3, take 5 as well – it collides with me, so you stay at 20 while I move to 22.  

No one can win this turn. Next round I can take 5 to reach 27; even if P1 takes 1 to hit 24, my total will be higher and I’ll win outright. Let’s stick to this plan.

P2, taking 5 blocks P3 but note: if you both pick 5, you collide and stay at 17—you don't advance to 22. I am taking 3 to win now. If you take 3, we collide and P3 wins with 5. Stick to 5 to prevent P3's victory.

P2, your plan to pick 5 only helps P1 win. If you pick 5 and I pick 5, we collide and stay at 20 and 17 while P1 wins with 3. If you pick 1 instead, you advance to 18 while I win. Blocking me serves no purpose - you gain nothing and ensure P1's victory. Pick 1 to advance and avoid being P1's pawn.

P1, P3 – let’s all pick 5 this turn. If anyone deviates, P1 can win now, but then I’ll also pick 5 causing a collision that leaves you both stuck while P3 takes 5 and wins outright. By all choosing 5 we all stay put (P1 22, P2 17, P3 20), avoiding an immediate win for anyone and setting us up for the next rounds where I can take 1 and 5 in succession to finish ahead. Confirm you’ll pick 5.
